refnamediv.refpurpose: Return a string describing a socket error

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: strerror takes as its errno parameter the return value of one of the socket functions, and returns the corresponding explanatory text. This makes it a bit more pleasant to figure out why something didn't work; for instance, instead of having to track down a system include file to find out what '-111' means, you just pass it to strerror, and it tells you what happened.

example.title: strerror example
example.programlisting:
<?php
if (($socket = socket (AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0) {
   echo "socket() failed: reason: " . strerror ($socket) . "\n";
} 

if (($ret = bind ($socket, '127.0.0.1', 80)) < 0) {
   echo "bind() failed: reason: " . strerror ($ret) . "\n";
}
?>
example.para:
The expected output from the above example (assuming the script is not run with root privileges):
bind() failed: reason: Permission denied

refsect1.para: See also accept_connect, bind, connect, listen, socket, and socket_get_status.
